private.question: You plan to act as PIC carrying passengers in daytime. What recent flight experience is required?
choices: 3 takeoffs and landings in the preceding 90 days in the same category/class
5 takeoffs and landings in the preceding 6 months in any aircraft
A flight review in the preceding 12 calendar months
3 hours of instrument time in the preceding 90 days
private.explanation: FAR 61.57 requires 3 takeoffs and landings in the preceding 90 days in the same category/class to carry passengers.

private.question: Which document must be aboard the aircraft for VFR flight?
choices: Pilot logbook
Airworthiness certificate
FAA Practical Test Standards
Weight and balance training endorsement
private.explanation: ARROW: Airworthiness certificate must be aboard per 14 CFR 91.203.

private.question: For VFR day flight, what fuel reserve is required?
choices: 30 minutes at normal cruising speed
45 minutes at normal cruising speed
60 minutes at holding speed
No reserve required if flight is less than 50 NM
private.explanation: 14 CFR 91.151 requires 30 minutes of fuel for VFR day.

private.question: A private pilot may share operating expenses with passengers provided the pilot pays at least:
choices: 25% of the direct operating expenses
50% of the direct operating expenses
A pro-rata share of the direct operating expenses
All fuel and oil costs only
private.explanation: Private pilots must pay at least their pro-rata share of fuel, oil, airport expenses, or rental fees (61.113).

private.question: Minimum safe altitude over congested areas is:
choices: 500 feet AGL
1,000 feet above the highest obstacle within a horizontal radius of 2,000 feet
1,000 feet AGL
2,000 feet above terrain
private.explanation: 14 CFR 91.119(b) sets 1,000 feet above highest obstacle within 2,000 feet over congested areas.

commercial.question: A commercial pilot may act as PIC carrying persons or property for compensation when:
choices: Operating under Part 91 and holding at least a second-class medical
Operating under Part 135 without a medical
Operating under Part 91 but only with a CFI on board
Operating under Part 61 with no recent flight experience
commercial.explanation: Commercial pilots can carry persons/property for compensation under Part 91 with appropriate medical and endorsements.

commercial.question: What are the instrument currency requirements to act as PIC under IFR?
choices: 6 approaches, holding, and intercepting/tracking in the preceding 6 calendar months
3 approaches in the preceding 90 days
A proficiency check every 12 months
Night currency only
commercial.explanation: 14 CFR 61.57(c) requires 6 approaches, holding, and intercepting/tracking in 6 calendar months.

commercial.question: Which operation requires compliance with 14 CFR 91.211 (supplemental oxygen)?
choices: Cabin pressure altitude 12,500 feet for more than 30 minutes
Cabin pressure altitude 8,000 feet for more than 1 hour
Cabin pressure altitude 10,000 feet for more than 2 hours
Cabin pressure altitude 14,000 feet for more than 15 minutes
commercial.explanation: 91.211: oxygen required for crew above 12,500 feet for more than 30 minutes.

commercial.question: How long must aircraft maintenance records be retained for annual inspection?
choices: For 12 calendar months
For 24 calendar months
Until the next annual or 100-hour inspection
For the life of the aircraft
commercial.explanation: Records of annual/100-hour inspections must be retained until superseded by next inspection (91.417).

commercial.question: A commercial pilot may carry passengers in tailwheel airplanes only if within the preceding 90 days:
choices: 3 takeoffs and landings in a tailwheel aircraft
5 takeoffs and landings in any aircraft
3 hours of dual instruction
A flight review in a tailwheel aircraft
commercial.explanation: Tailwheel passenger currency requires 3 takeoffs and landings in a tailwheel aircraft (61.57).

cfi.question: When providing flight instruction, a CFI must endorse a student pilot's logbook for solo flight:
choices: Once every 90 days
Every 30 days
Every 60 days
Every 12 months
cfi.explanation: Solo endorsements for student pilots are valid for 90 days for repeated solo, but each specific make/model endorsement must be within 30 days (61.87).

cfi.question: A CFI renewal can be accomplished by:
choices: Passing a practical test for any certificate or rating
Logging 100 hours of dual given in 24 months
Completing an FAA-approved flight instructor refresher course
All of the above
cfi.explanation: CFI renewal options include checkride, 100 hours of instruction, or FIRC (61.197).

cfi.question: A student pilot can carry a passenger if:
choices: The passenger is a CFI
The passenger is a safety pilot
The passenger is a pilot examiner
A student pilot may not carry passengers
cfi.explanation: Student pilots are prohibited from carrying passengers (61.89).

cfi.question: A CFI may log PIC time while giving instruction when:
choices: Acting as the sole manipulator of the controls
Instructing in an aircraft for which they are rated
Instructing in an aircraft with no medical certificate
Only when the student is not rated
cfi.explanation: CFIs log PIC while instructing in an aircraft for which they are rated (61.51).

cfi.question: An endorsement for a flight review is valid for:
choices: 12 calendar months
24 calendar months
36 calendar months
Until the next medical expiration
cfi.explanation: 14 CFR 61.56 requires flight review every 24 calendar months.
